---
title: "Datenauswertung "
author: "Sabrina Michl"
date: "2023-01-25"
categories: [code, analysis]
bibliography: ref.bib
---


# Vorbemerkung

Es werden zur Auswertung die Daten von @wiegand2019germeval verwendet. Diese Daten sind nach CC-BY-4.0 lizensiert.

Außerdem werden wordembeddings von @grave2018learning verwendet. Diese Daten sind nach Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported (CC-BY-SA 3.0) lizensiert.

# 3. Datensatz laden & kleine Änderungen vornehhmen

## Trainingsdatensatz


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_train <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.training.txt", col_names = FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 5009 Columns: 3
-- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
Delimiter: "\t"
chr (3): X1, X2, X3

i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::
:::


### Spalten umbenennen


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
names(d_train) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")
```
:::


### ID-Spalte einfügen


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_train <- d_train %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())
```
:::


## Testdatensatz


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_test <- read_tsv("C:/Users/sapi-/OneDrive/Studium/5. Semester/Data Science II/Data_Science_Blog/daten/germeval2018.test.txt", col_names = FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 2228 Columns: 3
-- Column specification --------------------------------------------------------
Delimiter: "\t"
chr (3): X1, X2, X3

i Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
i Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::
:::


### Spalten umbenennen


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
names(d_test) <- c("text", "c1", "c2")
```
:::


### ID-Spalte einfügen


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
d_test <- d_test %>% 
  mutate(id = row_number()) %>% 
  select(id, everything())
```
:::
